title: Drawing, Study for a Portrait of Mr. Morris K. Jesup, Esq. with Study for a Portrait of Mr. Schermerhorn, verso, May 1896
title_raw: Study for a Portrait of Mr. Morris K. Jesup, Esq. with Study for a Portrait of Mr. Schermerhorn, verso
medium: Graphite on light brown wove paper
inscribed:
Lower left in graphite: Sketch for portrait / Mr. Jesup / it must be 44 x 56 if this arrangement is taken
Lower right in graphite: May 96 / he was afraid of the big book (Nat'l history?) / aand the fur lined robe that Mrs.Jesup said would / please her / (not adapted)
description:
Recto: A man sits facing right with a large book in his lap.
Verso: Man seated in a armchair facing left, papers in his right hand

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Study for a Portrait of Mr. Morris K. Jesup, Esq. with Study for a Portrait of Mr. Schermerhorn, verso, May 1896. Graphite on light brown wove paper. 
Bequest of Erskine Hewitt. 1942-50-590
